raw_text:
Sony PSP tipped as a 'must-have'
 
 Sony's Playstation Portable is the top UK gadget for 2005, according to a round-up of ultimate gizmos compiled by Stuff Magazine.
 
 It beats the iPod into second place in the Top Ten Essentials list which predicts what gadget-lovers are likely to covet this year. Owning all 10 gadgets will set the gadget lover back £7,455. That is £1,000 cheaper than last year's list due to falling manufacturing costs making gadgets more affordable.
 
 Portable gadgets dominate the list, including Sharp's 902 3G mobile phone, the Pentax Optio SV digital camera and Samsung's Yepp YH-999 video jukebox.
 
 "What this year's Essentials shows is that gadgets are now cheaper, sexier and more indispensable than ever. We've got to the point where we can't live our lives without certain technology," said Adam Vaughan, editor of Stuff Essentials. The proliferation of gadgets in our homes is inexorably altering the role of the high street in our lives thinks Mr Vaughan. "Take digital cameras, who would now pay to develop an entire film of photos? Or legitimate downloads, who would travel miles to a record shop when they could download the song in minutes for 70p?" he asks. Next year will see a new set of technologies capturing the imaginations of gadget lovers, Stuff predicts. The Xbox 2, high-definition TV and MP3 mobiles will be among the list of must-haves that will dominate 2006, it says. The spring launch of the PSP in the UK is eagerly awaited by gaming fans.

The list highlights the proliferation of portable technology in our daily lives, with gadgets like Samsung's Yepp YH-999 video jukebox and Sharp's 902 3G mobile phone becoming new must-haves for 2006.

The article predicts that in 2006, technologies such as Xbox 2, high-definition TV, and MP3 mobiles will dominate consumer interest, with the PlayStation Portable's spring UK launch anticipated by gaming fans.

smollm:1.7b:
The top gadgets for 2005 are:

1. Sony PlayStation Portable (SPP)
2. Sharp's 902 3G mobile phone
3. Pentax Optio SV digital camera
4. Samsung's Yepp YH-999 video jukebox

The top gadgets for 2006 are:

1. Sony PlayStation Portable (SPP)
2. Sharp's 902 3G mobile phone
3. Pentax Optio SV digital camera
4. Samsung's Yepp YH-999 video jukebox
5. High-definition TV
6. MP3 mobiles
7. Xbox 2 (next year)
8. PSP in the UK (next year)

Alright, so I need to summarize this text about Sony's PS5 (PS Portable) for the UK. Let me read through the provided text carefully.

First, it mentions that the PSP was tipped as a "must-have." That seems important because it sets its position among gadgets. Then, from Stuff Magazine's round-up of ultimate gizmos, it says it beats the iPod second place, which is interesting because the PSP might have been ahead last year but now it's catching up.

The text mentions that owning all 10 listed gadgets would cost £7,455 this year. Last year, without some features, it was cheaper by £1,000 due to falling costs from cheaper manufacturing. So, this shows a trend where gadgets have become more affordable and essential. That's a key point.

Next, the PSP is noted as having mobile phones like Sharp's 902 3G, digital cameras like Pentax Optio SV, and video jukeboxes like Samsung's Yepp YH-999. It also points out that while some of these are physical devices, the PS5 is an essential for many people.

The editor Adam Vaughan talks about the impact on the high street—gadgets now being cheaper, sexier, and more necessary than ever. He mentions how digital cameras have shifted to paying for developing entire films, which might not be feasible anymore, and how downloads are moving away from physical stores favoring online services.

He also predicts that next year will see new technologies like the Xbox 2 and high-definition TVs dominate the list, with MP3 mobiles. The PSP is eagerly awaited by gaming fans because it's a top device for their games.

Sony's PlayStation Portable (PS5) has been tipped as a "must-have" gadget for the UK, according to Stuff Magazine. It competes with the iPod, placing second in its Top Ten Essentials list. Owning all 10 gadgets would cost £7,455 this year, compared to last year's higher figure due to falling costs from cheaper manufacturing. The PSP is noted as having a range of essential devices: a Sharp 902 3G phone, Pentax Optio SV digital camera, and Samsung Yepp YH-999 video jukebox. It highlights the rise in affordable and indispensable nature of gadgets. editor Adam Vaughan suggests that gadgets are now cheaper, sexier, and more vital than ever, with digital cameras shifting towards online services and mobile phones favoring downloads. He predicts a push for new technologies like Xbox 2, high-definition TVs, and MP3 phones next year. The PSP is eagerly awaited by gaming enthusiasts as a top gadget for their games.

In terms of must-have devices for gaoglelet-lovers, Stuff predicts that gamers will be captivated by next year's new technologies such as the Xbox 2, high-definition TVs, and MP3 mobile phones.
